headline: Affirm Holdings (AFRM) Is Down 5.4% After Q2 Beat And Outlook Hike What’s Changed
summary: Affirm Holdings reported past second-quarter fiscal 2026 results with sales of US$586.65 million and net income of US$129.59 million, alongside a raised full-year outlook. Alongside the earnings beat, new and expanded partnerships with Intuit’s QuickBooks, Wayfair, Expedia, Fiserv and Bolt highlight Affirm’s push deeper into merchant, small-business and international ecosystems. Against this backdrop, we’ll examine how the earnings beat and raised outlook shape Affirm’s investment narrative...

headline: The software names investors can capitalize on amid tech rout
summary: RBC Capital Markets managing director on software Rishi Jaluria explores his top stock picks and the biggest losers he foresees in the software space, including HubSpot (HUBS), Intuit (INTU), and MongoDB (MDB). Be sure to also catch Rishi Jaluria explain why software stocks are overreacting to the recent advancements in AI. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Asking for a Trend.

headline: Here’s What Affirm Holding’s Introduction of Buy Now, Pay Later to QuickBooks Means For Investors
summary: Affirm Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:AFRM) is one of the 10 best financial stocks to buy for the long term. On February 2, Intuit announced that it was adding buy now, pay later (BNPL) options to QuickBooks through a new multi-year partnership with Affirm Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ:AFRM). headline: Intuit Partnerships With Affirm And Checkr Test QuickBooks Moat And Valuation
summary: Intuit (NasdaqGS:INTU) has entered multi year partnerships with Affirm and Checkr to expand QuickBooks capabilities for small business customers. The Affirm integration will bring pay over time options into QuickBooks Payments, while the Checkr collaboration will embed background checks directly into QuickBooks Online Payroll and Intuit Enterprise Suite. Intuit, trading at $443.77 at the last close, is rolling out these product partnerships at a time when the share price has seen a 29.5%...
